intro: Machaeranthera brevilingulata, commonly known as the short-ligulate blazing star, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem.
